releases.details: Doctor Who: The Crusade/The Space Museum release

notes: The story was originally titled 'The Saracen Hordes'.
Only the first and third episodes, 'The Lion' and 'The Wheel of Fortune', exist in the BBC Archives.
William Hartnell demanded that dialogue implying an incestuous relationship between Richard and Joanna be removed.
Julian Glover and Jean Marsh were aware of the original intentions and were keen to reinstate the sensual undertones, but were deterred by Verity Lambert.
William Russell refused to participate in the scene where ants crawl up Ian's arm, and Viktors Ritelis agreed to double for him.
Julian Glover did not enjoy working with William Hartnell, describing him as 'cold' and 'insecure'.
David Whitaker held this story up as his finest technical achievement, and Douglas Camfield claimed he didn't have to change a single line.
Douglas Camfield cast Julian Glover after seeing him in An Age of Kings, and Walter Randall was cast as El Akir due to his friendship with Camfield.
The costume worn by Julian Glover as Richard the Lionheart was previously worn by Peter O'Toole in the role.

in_universe_mythology: References to in-universe mythology or lore.
real_world_cultural_references: Barbara plans to tell Saladin the stories of Romeo and Juliet, Gulliver's Travels and Hans Christian Andersen's fairy tales.
Richard's party uses hawks for hunting.
items: Metal coins offered by El Akir to Barbara

continuity_notes: The Doctor tells Vicki that time must be allowed to run its course, as he had previously told Barbara.
Barbara makes reference to several previous adventures when talking to Saladin.
Ian is later knighted as 'Sir Ian of Jaffa'.
The Fifth Doctor later meets a robot he mistakes for King John, Richard's younger brother.

plot.plot_summary: The TARDIS arrives in 12th century Palestine during the Crusades. Barbara is abducted by Saracens, and the Doctor, Ian and Vicki make their way to King Richard's palace in Jaffa. Ian is knighted and sent to Saladin's court to request the release of Barbara and des Preaux. Meanwhile, Barbara befriends Haroun's family while evading the clutches of the villainous El Akir. The Doctor and Vicki are accused of theft but cleared, while Ian rescues Barbara and the others escape in the TARDIS as the Earl of Leicester tries to have them arrested for treason.
